p: Overnight fasting animals were given AS-AT (300 mg/kg) for continuous 7 days. A urine sample was collected on the first and seventh days in a graduated cylinder for 6 hours. Urine volume, sodium, and potassium concentration were estimated. Blood was collected by cardiac puncture, and serum was obtained by centrifugation (2000 rpm, 10 mins, 4°C) to measure the plasma concentration of sodium and potassium by an automated electrolyte analyzer [ 22].
